column4: Hi, I need help. So, I can't to start ubuntu, I don't know, flash caps lock and scroll lock. Any ideas?
are you running ubuntu on a laptop?
no. I am running on desktop.
i had that problem in early alpha's of jaunty, it turned out to be my i945 chipset and my wireless card causing system lockups
but i was on a laptop so i doubt that you have the same problem as me
you could look at your logs or dmesg and see if theres any warnings or errors before the lockup
here, I use a desktop.
how to look the log?
open a text editor and browse to /var/log
but, the ubuntu dont start here.
oooh
explain "it wont start"
ubuntu dont start, stop on screen of loading.
the splash startup screen?
restart it and then hit alt-f2 to display the text and see what the error is
thats its. splash screen.
alt-f2 will switch to text mode, so when the splash screen comes up, hit alt-f2 and look at the text, try and read it, and see if it comes up with an error
yeah. stop on splash screen.
ok man, thank you, i'm testing now.
